fields.description: Workaround is to go private temporarily, add readers, then go public again. Not a huge problem, but it'd be nice if the issue tracker could have a setting where anyone could claim a bug.

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I m just testing your product and I see than If I open a free account and click "Plans" and selected a products, at the next page I can click "Repositories" (menu) and create all Repositories that I want without to have pay something.\\
If one repository is created, the create option stay in menu to create others.

fields.description: I'd like to be able to upload a photo to the wiki instead of having to link to a photo hosted elsewhere.
fields.summary: Allow users to upload pictures to wiki

fields.description: It would be nice if one could not only see forks that were created via the website but also other repositories that share a common history.
fields.summary: Related repositories (BB-336)

fields.description: It would be nice to hear a notification if the repo is updated or a ticket is created.
fields.summary: Sound triggers when update happens

fields.description: The Issues tab in my repository has a helpful count of open issues displayed in it.  To me, this means that it is primarily about open issues, which it should be, since open issues are the important ones.   But when I click a tab that says "Issues (2)", I expect to see a page that displays 2 issues.  Today, it takes me to a page showing 5 total issues, with 2 open ones.  I think the default action for the Issues tab should be to show only open issues.  This is what most people need to see, and will align the page contents with the tab label.
fields.summary: Clicking the Issues tab should show open issues

fields.description: When I edited the main page of the Help, preview showed an error with the macro.
fields.summary: Wiki preview show macros as error (BB-678)

fields.description: See title.
fields.summary: Repository feeds (rss/atom) should include wiki activity (BB-691)

fields.description: It would be nice with syntax highlighting support for the Groovy language.

fields.description: See title.

fields.description: of the 5 forks of django-piston, 3 have no description. If I find piston through any of this forks, I'll have no idea what it's about. make sense to always show the original forks description as well.
fields.summary: add a forks orginal description to the description

fields.description: be nice to have something like http://django-piston.bitbucket.org
fields.summary: A short repository url

fields.description: I have several tags in my repository, which are listed in .hgtags, and which show up when I clone and perform hg tags.  But they do not appear in the dropdown list of tags on the overview page, nor do they appear under tags and snapshots on the downloads page.  Please can you take a look?
fields.summary: tags not showing up in web interface (BB-690)

The tag <<issues ?component=loginsystem>> returns:

{code}

fields.description:
I can clone wiki repositories using HTTP:

{{{\\
#!

% hg clone https://dribin@bitbucket.org/ddribin/ddcli/wiki/\\
destination directory: wiki\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 1 changesets with 1 changes to 1 files\\
updating working directory\\
1 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved

}}}\\
but not SSH:

{{{\\
#!

% hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/ddribin/ddcli/wiki/\\
remote: abort: There is no Mercurial repository here (.hg not found)!\\
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!

}}}

I prefer SSH so I can use ssh-agent to keep from getting asked passwords all the time.
fields.summary: Cannot clone wiki using ssh url

fields.description: When downloading a source archive of a tag using gz or bz2, the resulting filename is <project>-<tag>.{gz,bz2}, for example "foo-1.0.bz2".  However, they are not just gz or bz2 archives, they are tar files that are compressed.  Thus, that should be expressed in the extension, for example "foo-1.0.tar.bz2" and "foo-1.0.tar.gz".  Or, at the very least, use .tbz2 or .tgz extensions, such as "foo-1.0.tbz2".
fields.summary: Put "tar" in the filename for gz and bz2 downloads (BB-689)

fields.description:
The MIME types for gz/bz2 downloads seems to be application/x-tar.  Not only is this incorrect, it messes up Safari.  If the file name does not end in .tar, it adds it to be "helpful" (hey, you downloaded a tar file, right?).

For example, downloading foo on tag 1.0 as a bz2, results in a file called "foo-1.0.bz2.tar".  You should use application/x-bzip2 for bz2 and application/x-gzip for gzip.
fields.summary: Use proper MIME type for gz/bz2 downloads (BB-689)

fields.description:
This page demonstrates the strange duplication and broken HTML generated by the Wiki's Issues query:\\
http://bitbucket.org/test100/test100/wiki/Home

You may click "Edit" to edit that Wiki page, and then "Preview" and notice that the Issues query tags work properly in Preview Mode.  But when you save and view normally, they are broken again.
fields.summary: Issues view broken in Wiki VIEW but works in PREVIEW (test attached)

fields.description:
Please allow some way for users to receive update notification e-mails on Wiki changes.

* *Basic solution* is to allow repo owner to enable/disable this feature for himself.
* *More sophisticated*: would be to allow any users to follow all or any specific Wiki pages.

If this already exists, where/how can I enable it?  Thanks.
fields.summary: Wiki update notifications by e-mail

fields.description:
Your home page (for not logged in users) does not mention that there is an Issue Tracker or Wiki built in.

I almost overlooked this great site because of that, and only dug deeper because of a personal recommendation.
fields.summary: Make bitbucket.org home page describe the product better

fields.description:
Would love a "Time Estimate" or similar field in Issue Tracker.  Units could be in days (with granularity down to 0.25d) or hours (with easy way to enter #days too).

Once this is in, the next logical addition would be a presentation of "How much work is required for Milestone X?" (sum time estimates for Milestone).
fields.summary: Add "Time Estimate" field in Issue Tracker

fields.description: I see "You are currently surpassing your quota. You are not limited yet, but we will manually limit the account unless space is freed or plan is upgraded" on every page, but my 'Account' page says "You are currently on the free plan, using 0 bytes out of 150.0 MB total (0%)."
fields.summary: Surpassing my quota?

fields.description:
The installation instructions for the documentation ask to use "assistant -addContentFile ... ". However, Qt Assistant responds with an error message that this commandline option is not supported. Instead, I successfully installed the doc from within Qt Assistant by manually adding index.dcf (German version: Bearbeiten | Einstellungen -> Dokumentation -> Hinzufügen ...).

The path to index.dcf is also incorrect in the wiki (index.dcf is in subdirectory deploy/docs).
fields.summary: Installation instructions on wiki

fields.description:
I'm not sure if this is a bug or just some misunderstanding on my part of hg magic with named branches and transplant, but take a look:

https://bitbucket.org/bbangert/pylons/

The project has three branches, and it's common to transplant a change from trunk to the others. Most of the time, when you see these series of three commits, the first one shows that files are modified, and the subsequent ones show that they're deleted! Even the diff and raw changeset views indicate such. {{{hg log}}} certainly doesn't look this way -- it shows the same patch on each different branch as you'd expect.

Oddly, one recent set of these (pjenvey's commit 'Jython includes an mtime...') does not exhibit this behavior and works as expected.
fields.summary: revs transplanted across branches show files as deleted?

fields.description:
I'm testing issues service and POST webhook with my repo. If one of those is enabled, every push ends up with following error message:

{{{\\
...\\
remote: bb/acl: Uninen is allowed. accepted payload.\\
remote: error: changegroup.oberon hook raised an exception:\\
'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc3 in position 7: ordinal not in range(128)\\
}}}
fields.summary: Exception in changegroup.oberon when using hooks

fields.description: See http://mail.python.org/pipermail/python-dev/2009-March/087931.html
fields.summary: Add Python to list of Hg-using projects on homepage

fields.description:
Sorry if I'm missing the obvious here...

I have a private repo with private Issues and private Wiki.\\
How can I invite other users to collaborate on these?

Do they need to create bitbucket accounts first, and then tell me their account names, and then I type that into "Permissions: Writers"?

Are there docs available on this type of collaboration?  I'm not seeing any.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Invite users to private repo + Wiki + Issues?

fields.description:
The A/M/D columns in the repository Overview page should have tooltips that explain their meaning (e.g. "Added files")

The repository Changesets page should also have tooltips for the three A/M/D numbers.
fields.summary: A/M/D columns should have tooltips

fields.description:
There are truly private projects, but in some cases you just want to keep development on the downlow.  It might be a project you don't want to announce, or maybe you want to make sure the repository page doesn't steal google juice from your main project page.

To avoid this it would be nice to have a project option to turn off indexing (with a meta no-index tag in the header of the pages).
fields.summary: Project option to hide from search engines

fields.description:
One bit of pushback I've gotten on using a hosted service instead of self-hosting for source code is a concern that the project URL effectively belongs to the hosting service.

It would mitigate this concern if you could, on leaving bitbucket, register a new URL and requests would be redirected to that new URL.
fields.summary: Redirect on project deletion

fields.description:
The HTML diff display when viewing a changeset escapes < and > but not &, so HTML entities in the source files get rendered instead of being shown as source.

Consider this changeset, where — and → are being shown rendered in the second file: http://bitbucket.org/jace/zine-main/changeset/e89dbb0456fd/
fields.summary: HTML entities not encoded in changeset diff display
0 and None are being shown as an empty string in fields

fields.description:
=== Steps to reproduce ===

h1. Follow someone
h1. Go to one of their repositories
=== Expected Results ===\\
I will show up as a follower, as I get all the notifications and what not.

=== Actual Results ===\\
I do not show up as a follower.
fields.summary: Those following a user should show up as followers of all the user's repos

fields.description: Apparently one can follow oneself.  Seems redundant.
fields.summary: Follow self (very low priority)

fields.description:
Hello,

I signed in through OpenID (MyOpenID is my provider) to follow a repository. After signing in I saw the firefox error page for an infinite redirect loop ("Firefox has detected that the server is redirecting the request for this address in a way that will never complete").

The URL in the browser was:

http://bitbucket.org/account/signin/?next=/noahgift/adapt/follow/

Since it redirected improperly (until firefox stopped it) it sent the follow/un-follow command maybe 30 or so times. You can see it on my user page here:

http://bitbucket.org/lost_theory/\\
{{{\\
lost_theory began following adapt\\
55 seconds ago\\
lost_theory stopped following adapt\\
55 seconds ago\\
lost_theory began following adapt\\
58 seconds ago\\
lost_theory stopped following adapt\\
58 seconds ago\\
etc..\\
}}}

Let me know if you need any other information.

Thank you for BitBucket!

-Steve
fields.summary: Infinite redirect after signing in with OpenID

fields.description:
When someone hosts his project on bitbucket.org and associates it with a custom CNAME, he can link to his projet with an url like http://his.domain.tld/username/project

If the project is forked, then forks will be indicated in the forks/queues page but *links to them will be incorrect*, using the same CNAME instead of the bitbucket.org domain.

You can see an example with the django-authopenid using the url http://hg.e-engura.org/django-authopenid/descendants/

Maybe this problem appears in other pages.
fields.summary: When using a custom CNAME with bitbucket, forks links are not correct (BB-685))

fields.description:
would be nice if bb provided a template parameter for the CIA service.

we would like clickable urls, branch, info, and maybe some other info in the notification.

the hgcia plugin provides this feature

fields.description:
Hi all,

this is a feature I found on some other issue tracking systems. Basically a commit comment with keywords will act on the issue tracker consequently. Some examples:

* "fixes|closes|solves BCLOUD-24" closes the ticket and adds comment "fixed in rev xxxx" or "fixed by commit yyyy" to issue
* don't really think there are other uses for this, any ideas?
fields.summary: Commit macros

fields.description:
It would be nice if following a space will notify you also about commits & wiki edits, just like what happens in your "newsfeed".

Obviously those changes may be added through an option (not everybody would be happy being notified of everything).

fields.description: When reporting issues to you guys, I'd like to make sure that the issue doesn't already exist.  The easiest way to do that would be to see all bugs that are either open or are new.  I have to do two queries to make that happen, which is too much work, so I don't bother.
fields.summary: Please allow "or" queries in the bug tracker

fields.description:
Right now, if I mouse over a drop-down (say, "tags" or "branches" in a repository, or the "Repositories" drop-down at the top), and I accidentally mouse out while trying to pick (because, e.g., I'm going for the last item in the menu, and accidentally overshoot slightly), it collapses back immediately.  I then have to reopen the menu and try again, this time being more careful to keep my mouse in the box.

It'd be nice if, like Mac and Windows menus, you gave me a moment to get back into the menu, specifically to cover cases like this where I'm just a little too quick with my mouse.

I think I already requested this once, and you fixed it once, but I may be misremembering.  Please let me know if the description still makes no sense.
fields.summary: Please make menus stay open momentarily if I mouse off (BB-688)

fields.description:
Login to bitbucket.org is not forced through https unless you use https://bitbucket.org explicitly.

It would be better if the login form is submitted through https even if you are visiting http://bitbucket.org and the default login page should redirect to https.

Also the change password form should be HTTPS by default. I suggest that the http://bitbucket.org/account/* is forced to https://bitbucket.org/account/
fields.summary: bitbucket.org secure login

fields.description:
Seems we have a problem when pasting SSH keys with newlines (and possibly other characters) after ssh-rsa/ssh-dss.

To reproduce:

* Generate a valid ssh-key, copy to an editor to make sure there's a newline after ssh-rsa/ssh-dss, e.g.:

ssh-rsa

AAAAB3N...

Click "add key". You'll get a warning saying this is not a valid SSH-key.
fields.summary: Newlines in SSH keys

See http://dev.libqxt.org/libqxt/issue/2/crash-in-qxttcpconnectionmanager-when-using#comment-13234

The r1373 link is a relative path which would work for bitbucket.org but does not work for http://dev.libqxt.org

There are other places (I think) where there are similar issues with links.

fields.description:
When viewing changesets, HTML is rendered by the browser instead of escaped like when browsing the source tree manually.

See http://bitbucket.org/avu/taggit/changeset/5b31a9f555b1/ for an example of what I mean.
fields.summary: HTML unescaped in changesets

fields.description: I posted a comment that had two changeset links in it. It seems the preview does a greedy match for things between << and >>, because it matched the first changeset << to the second changeset >> and rendered everything in between as one changeset link.
fields.summary: Issue comment preview incorrectly renders multiple changesets (BB-683)

fields.description:
Currently Bitbucket allows per-repository google analytics tracking (<<issue 368>>), but per-user tracking would be very useful.

Each user would be able to set an analytics tracking key for their account, and this would insert the appropriate tracking code on every page under /username/.

This would allow them to see statistics on all their repositories with a single tracking key, and would mean that users do not have to manually generate and enter a new tracking key for each project.

Sound doable?
fields.summary: User based google analytics (BB-682)

fields.description: Hard to find otherwise. Guess it's part of n-h either way.
fields.summary: Link to /help from frontpage

fields.description:
Hi,

it would be nice to be able to message a user directly from his profile page.
fields.summary: Message user from profile page

fields.description:
It would be nice if the file history showed the history across copies, e.g. log -f.

Otherwise it's difficult to track the full history of a file that has been renamed.  It doesn't show up in the source file list, so you must know that the file was renamed, and look at the source before its "first" revision.
fields.summary: File history should follow copies and renames (BB-681)

fields.description: Currently, "Create" is lost in the list after "Issues". It would be nice if it stood out better (logically, it's quite different from the rest: All, Open, Mine, Query).
fields.summary: Visually separate "Create" issue action

fields.description: Instead of asking people to copy and paste their SSH public key into a text area it would make more sense to let them upload the key directly.
fields.summary: Upload SSH key as a file
Avatars aligned incorrectly on personal newsfeed in Safari
changeset diff view shows encoded quotes

fields.description: On http://bitbucket.org/durin42/hgsubversion/descendants/ my listed queue has the correct name (hgsubversion-mq), but the URLs are wrong; the hyphens are removed. To make things more confusing, this only happens sometimes. I booted up my VM to see if that was the difference, but now the URLs are showing up correctly. Normally I would just assume I'm really tired, but this switch has happened several times now.
fields.summary: Link to mq repository incorrect (sometimes)

fields.description: .ss extension is often used for scheme source code now, but bitbucket only highlights .scm.
fields.summary: Associate .ss extension with scheme for syntax highlighting purposes

fields.description:
Sorry if this issue is duplicated, but I didn't find any opend issue related.

I want to clone my wiki (http://bitbucket.org/willie/hg-cht-translation/wiki/Home) and edit it off-line, but after I cloned it (hg clone https://willie@bitbucket.org/willie/hg-cht-translation/wiki/), the Home.wiki in my local repo is still the default English template. The changes I made did not appeared.

I've posted this issue in http://groups.google.com/group/bitbucket-users, but no one replied yet.

Also, while I try to push back, bitbucket says that I have no permission:

{{{\\
willie@laptop:/tmp/wiki$ hg push\\
pushing to https://willie@bitbucket.org/willie/hg-cht-translation/wiki/\\
searching for changes\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: willie\\
password:\\
abort: authorization failed\\
willie@laptop:/tmp/wiki$\\
}}}
fields.summary: Cannot clone wiki repo

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be nice to have a way to contact users without having to hunt down their contact details.

On the short term a contact form would be great.

On the long term stuff like an integrated jabber server would be even nicer, maybe a server where all people who contribute to projects I follow are automatically added to my contact list.
fields.summary: User contact form - and other ways to get in contact

fields.description: To facilitate threading and sorting of the email notifications sent from the issue tracker, use an In-Reply-To header.  Whether the Message-ID of the first notification ("New issue...") or of the previous notification is used is probably not so important.  Both choices would make it easier to deal with a larger number of issue notifications in the email client.  I for one would prefer the first option, In-Reply-To the "New issue" mail.
fields.summary: Use In-Reply-To heades for email updates on issues
cfunction scope and roles

fields.description:
Bitbucket is quite nice as it is, but it would be great if it were possible to tie a bunch of repositories together without linking them to one particular account. For instance, they could share issue tracker and wiki. Generally speaking, most other project hosting facilities are full of crap which just gets in your way. Bitbucket might be able to make a reasonable profit hosting both open source and proprietary projects with only a little bit of tuning and reorganisation of what you have. To differentiate it from your account offering (and perhaps justify different pricing) you could include a mailing list, or similar collaborative tools.

Just a thought…
fields.summary: Project hosting (BB-53)

fields.description: http://www.selenic.com/mercurial/wiki/index.cgi/ShallowClone
fields.summary: Make wiki text darker and larger

fields.description:
The CSS stylesheet for the changeset view uses grey text. Generally speaking, grey text is often suboptimal from a readability point of view, even though it may look good. However, printing on a budget monochrome laser printer, such as the one I have, makes it even worse; on most monochrome printers, dithering causes anything but black text to be hard to read.

I've attached an example printout from Safari 4 on a Mac. If you're interested, I can try to get a photo of the resulting printout. I'll see if I can dig up an example of a view I tuned for print readability too.
fields.summary: Changeset view uses (unreadable) grey text for printing

fields.description:
If you guys were to feature the scrum workflow you'd be an enormous hit (and the Assembla guys would cry), I have been looking for issue trackers with the scrum workflow and mercurial or git, and I could only find Redmine (and a scrumalliance plugin: http://www.redmine.org/boards/3/topics/4014, http://www.redmine.org/boards/1/topics/1214) and Trac + Agilo (mercurial integration is appart), both which are a pain to setup in shared hosting environments.

Explicitly supporting the Scrum workflow could imply the following.

{code}
* That one could optionally use the scrum workflow in another tab.
* That one could track issue items with no milestone/version/component as backlog items.
* That one could track issue items with in a milestone/version/component as sprint items. Essentially, a milestone/version/component could be seen as a sprint.
* That one could make daily scrum reports for a project (answer the questions: what have i done, what am i doing and what are my obstacles) that one could see in a little per user/project feed similar to the actual account homepage activity feed, but this would be within the project.
* The ability to asign "story points" to issues. It would be utterly awesome if one could invite the "product owners" (register a user for them and give them read permission for the repository) to a more simple/friendly version of the issue tracker for them to input directly their "user stories" in the fashion of a CRM (a very little one =P) that only shows the tickets input by them, and collaborate with developers in a truly agile way.
* That one could see the burndown chart for milestone/versions/components. I strongly suggest using Open Flash Charts (http://teethgrinder.co.uk/open-flash-chart/).
* And if possible, a scrum task board (http://maxheapsize.com/2009/02/19/the-scrumboard-cheat-sheet/; http://www.mountaingoatsoftware.com/task-boards), that lets you add/remove/drag issues, modifying the burndown chart on-the-fly.
{code}

Even while featuring this workflow, some tools/services (i.e. Assembla) don't really feature user stories, which are for describing the client/user viewpoint of the requirements with a certain score assigned (story points) depending on its importance to the project.

I recently toured myself around the existing issues in the bitbucket tracker and spotted a comment where you guys said you like to keep stuff simple, so if you don't really feel like explicitly supporting Scrum, how about the following to be scrum-compatible?:

{code}
* A wiki macro for the milestone/version/component burndown charts with a target date as parameter.
* Some sort of quantifier for the issues importance (could be priority). This quantifier would impact the burndown chart's render, i.e. closing a small ticket would show as a small burndown.
* A taskboard that let one swiftly drag & drop issues across milestones/versions/components and directly edit their quantifier and status.
* Maybe the scrum reports would be the harder to integrate without altering bitbucket, so how about just a button for the issue comment-box that asked the three questions (what I did, what am I doing and what are my obstacles) in javascript popups and generated a little table or some sort of formatting; this, along a comment-only feed for the repository, although the mailer would be enough already. If there was a way to filter the comments to look for scrum reports it'd be awesome.
* And of course, a help section for getting the most about the scrum workflow with these implementations.
{code}

I'd happily switch to a paid plan if this workflow was supported (at least the burndown, scrum reports and user stories); Assembla charges per user/month/space, which is nosnense since the total expenses would allow our team to rent our own VPS at slicehost and could easily setup redmine/trac.
fields.summary: Scrum workflow for Bitbucket

fields.description:
Hi, I think it would be pretty useful to be able to render a progressbar for a specific milestone/version/component showing the current closed tickets against the total; and perhaps optionally it would be cool to see as a "buffer bar" the current open ones, i.e. 80% closed tickets (in blue) + 6% open (in light blue).

Generation of the corresponding caption and maybe different colors for milestones/versions/components would also be nice.
fields.summary: Progress bar for milestones/versions/components (BB-680)

fields.description:
I get an Python error when i try to press ESC while in the RopeOpenProject command. Here is the related traceback:

Traceback (most recent call last):\\
File "<string>", line 1, in <module>\\
File "/home/phxx/.vim/custom/rope/pylibs/ropemode/decorators.py", line 53, in newfunc\\
return func(*args, **kwds)\\
File "/home/phxx/.vim/custom/rope/pylibs/ropemode/interface.py", line 88, in open_project\\
self.project = rope.base.project.Project(root)\\
File "/home/phxx/.vim/custom/rope/pylibs/rope/base/project.py", line 130, in *init*\\
projectroot = _realpath(projectroot).rstrip('/\')\\
File "/home/phxx/.vim/custom/rope/pylibs/rope/base/project.py", line 428, in _realpath\\
return os.path.realpath(os.path.abspath(os.path.expanduser(path)))\\
File "/usr/lib/python2.5/posixpath.py", line 313, in expanduser\\
if not path.startswith('~'):\\
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'startswith'

I think the self.env.ask_directory() in ropemode/interface.py:84 returns None if the prompt is aborted with ESC.
fields.summary: Python error while aborting the open project prompt

fields.description: The front page needs a link entitled "help" somewhere. After a brief search, I see no way at all of navigating to the help area.
fields.summary: add "help" link to front page when not logged  in

fields.description:
I upgraded from 0.6 to 0.7.2. on vista.\\
I made sure the instal directory (C:\Program Files\TortoiseHg) was deleted.\\
After installation of 0.7.2 all commands emit this warning :\\
*** failed to import extension hgext.hgconfig: No module named  hgconfig

In the faq it is stated that the upgradde to 0.7.2 will not show these warnings. And if they do it means you have upgraded from an old version in which case you should :\\
in the Mercurial.ini in your installation directory and comment out the 'hgext.hgconfig =' line in the [extensions] section.\\
I have only one Mercurial.ini on my system and it is in the instal dir (C:\Program Files\TortoiseHg) and it does not contain an entry for :\\
hgext.hgconfig so there is nothing to comment out.

How can I get rid of the warning ?
fields.summary: Upgrade to 0.7.2 : *** failed to import extension hgext.hgconfig: No module named hgconfig

fields.description:
Avatar's picture size is 35x35, but the size in the CSS file is 32x32.

{{{\\
#!css

.avatar {\\
border:1px solid #ECE4EA;\\
height:32px;\\
padding:2px;\\
width:32px;\\
}\\
}}}

Some avatars —like mine :)— look goofy with the wrong size.

Solutions I can think of:

* Fix the CSS
* Change the picture size to 32x32.
fields.summary: Bad avatar picture size (BB-679)

fields.description: ...even if not following issue updates.
fields.summary: Issue-reporter always receives email when issue is updated

fields.description:
Hello,

Within the sphinx documentation I couldn't find much multilanguage features.\\
I was wondering if it would be possible to build in some built in functionality to write your documentation in several languages?\\
I could imagine for example to have english, dutch and german documentation available for a given project within the same sphinx root.

While building the documentation those language versions could be considered too and some kind of language cross reference could be established. The dutch "intro.rst" could be linked to the (default) english one for example as being a translated version. At this point a language switch of some kind (at least for the html version) could be implemented too.

What do you think?

best regards,

Rico Moorman
fields.summary: Sphinx multilanguage features

fields.description:
Along with the "less / more" options it would be nice to have a "expand / collapse" option.  "collapse" would mean each changeset takes up one line only allowing us to see more history at once.

I've attached an example of what this collapsed view may look like.
fields.summary: feature request: collapsed view of changeset history
